reviews.review_msg: Dr. Li is a nice guy who has unfortunately completely given up on teaching. Bro simply does not care. I pray for any future takers of the classes he teaches that he retires soon.
love paul li, take any chem course with him and you will succeed. he will take the time to teach you content if you go to his review sessions before an exam. don't stress to impress.
Great Prof!

Great Guy, yes I know some students have mixed feelings, however I would like to emphasize how caring he was during office hours and his exams were not bad if you just went to lectures, east peasy lemon squeeze - jasper wong
Take it right now!
I only got a bad mark because I wasn't studying enough! But he is so kind!
Love him soooo much!
I loved that this class was so clear! He is amazing!

Terrible lectures as he will drone on and on and they are exceptionally boring to listen to.
However, his tests are fair and it is possible to do well on all of them. Homework and tutorials make up a good portion of the marks and most of the learning can be done through them instead of going to lecture.

Professor Li was really helpful during lectures as he went through examples that would end up showing up on exams, make sure to attend all his lectures. He was always super responsive in his emails and his exams were fair game. The class average for his chem class was higher than any other chem class, expect weekly  assignments to take a few hours.

Attendance rates were at about 30% for lectures. He refuses to buy a tablet and spends his time trying to draw with a mouse. He is fairly knowledgeable about chemistry, but I felt most of his teaching was him trying to impress us with his knowledge of "special relativity". His English isn't good. However the assignments/exams weren't difficult.

Paul Li's lectures are not helpful at all. The worse is that he goes through theory and history which isn't needed. It would be better to have lectures mainly based on questions which can further prepare for the exam. I would recommend to use the textbook and LON-CAPA instead of his lectures. Overall, maybe do it with another prof.

Paul Li's lectures were by far the worst lectures I have ever attended. If you want to make good use of your time, skip lectures and read textbook. His good points are that he follows the given textbook VERY closely and that the mid term and final pulls questions from textbook, lon capa and tutorials, so his examinations were actually overall fair.

Paul is a funny guy who is very knowledgeable about random things. However, I remember more random useless information from Paul then what is actually relevant to class. I don't recommend attending lectures unless you want to have a good laugh. Paul desparately needs an iPad as he write solutions to questions with his PC mouse.Prepare to self study

Lectures are not worth going to, plenty of mistakes in his solutions, focuses too much on some sections while skimming others. Only redeeming factor was how fair the midterm was. Final is much harder as alot of content post midterm is completely separate, and the given formula sheet is absolutely useless. Try to avoid.

Paul can't explain concepts clearly and concisely in an engaging way. Memorize your formulas because the ones he gives you on the formula sheet really aren't going to help you on the final... There's no written questions on exams; so say goodbye to part marks. Practice material he gave didn't really help much either for the final.

He needs to invest in a pen so he can stop trying to draw with his mouse on his computer. He takes too long to get to certain concepts and when he explains theories we need to know, he breezes over them. At this point the textbook can teach you better.
Midterm was fair, questions were very similar to assignments & practice questions. Paul is a nice guy but his lectures were not worth attending.
w prof (chem 121)
Mistakes all over lecture slides and assignments.

Read this 5/5 rating on his page: "Such a funny class, he makes chemistry so entertaining, did not disappoint and was excited the entire course! Hope he gets tenure!" You think a student wrote that? im crying bro this guy really wrote this himself. He is anything but ^ that. I hope he gets fired.
Take this class if you like crying every night.

This guy has horrible communication, he has no passion for what he teaches, his voice is monotone, and I don't understand how he became a professor. Do better SFU. Also, all the 5's you see on this page? He wrote them to balance out all the low ratings, 100%. No student talks like that, lets be real. Good try Paul, but you know what you're doing.

Dr. Li was an okay professor. He can only do so much as a professor. His exams were fair as most of the questions came straight out of lecture slides/Lon Capa and mc questions came from the practice sheets he posted on canvas. If you work 2 hours outside 1 hour lecture, you will end up with a good grade! Chemistry is not an easy subject.

No communication with TA and blame gen z and do not reflect his poor lecture only done with unorganized google search. The midterm was awful and the slides are just copy of the textbook. Did not go through material and just expect us to do with it. Hope people do not take the course with him in the future since I suffered from this nightmare.

I have no idea where the 5/5 ratings are coming from but I certainly would not believe them as even my TA had an obvious distain for him. His lectures were not at all helpful and the midterm was awful. Had a friend take it with a different prof - their midterm average was in the 80's, ours was 34%. Avoid at all costs.

Abusive to TAs, miscommunicates. Uses google image searches in place of proper slides. Took random attendance only after students gave up on learning from him, which was so he could refuse students help.

He repeatedly calls his students lazy when his exam average is 34%, entirely ignoring the fact AN EXAM SHOULD TEST MATERIAL THAT WAS TAUGHT.
Love this class!

ABSOLUTELY THE OPPOSITE OF AMAZING. He wrote all these reviews by himself to boost his own rating. DO NOT TAKE chem 122 with him it is absolutely horrible. He made one of the easiest courses seem like hell despite it only being a 2 credit course. EVERY single one of the 5 star reviews are FALSE DO NOT LET HIM DECEIVE YOU!!!!
Paul Li makes sure Chemistry is not a mystery! He is funny, caring and very reasonable.
Only con is that the final mark takes too long to release, other than that he is amazing!

Not sure where all these 5/5 ratings came from all of a sudden, maybe Paul Li made all those accounts to try to boost his rating. Don't believe any of them. Save yourself the trouble and wait until a different professor is available. He is rude, hard to understand, and here for the paycheck.

Google searches were used to explain major concepts. Tests did not seem fair and expected you to do a lot of research and self-studying beyond the lecture notes. The slides were not comprehensive and lacked information. Very frustrating and would avoid taking this class with this prof.
Professor Li was an excellent prof who ensured every student understood the lectures in every class by reiterating points he thought would be unclear 10/10!
The class was straightforward and clear, with little or no guidance and help, and was very kind and inspirational
This course made me love science even more, thinking of careers thanks to his inspirational guidance
Such a funny class, he makes chemistry so entertaining, did not disappoint and was excited the entire course! Hope he gets tenure!
Entertaining, charismatic and funny! Paul Li has it all, I think his class was one of the best Chem classes at SFU!
I think Paul Li tries hard, and it shows! Class was clear, not confusing and exams were fair and straightforward if you came to class
Great prof, with a lot of passion for the subject, I enjoyed it greatly!
honestly this class wasn't hard. anyone who says otherwise is coping and needs to get their life in check. If you study you will pass. If you fail, its your fault.
Final was way more fair
Avoid at all costs
Love him, love the course
Professor Li being bad at teaching is not true!
Very lovely, and makes you enjoy his class a lot
I think Prof Li has a bad rep, but he really is very nice
So kind and ready to help, I think he is one of the better chem profs
He may be tough at marking, but he curves really well
I think he is tough but fair, put in the work and you will get the mark
Eggcellent Proof. Love PaulLi, would have to take again for funsies
Amazing Prof, Would give him 6 stars if possible

This is not a case of me/my friends not studying enough and writing a bad review.

34% midterm average and he didn't care to acknowledge it in class

He put some titration questions from the lab on the midterm although the lab is not required to take.

Asked about 4 regions, and yet no homework was given on it.

Midterm has no correlation to MT
Slides are useless, and questions on test are not from lecture material.
he's great.
Lectures are a waste of time. Terribly designed test. Avoid him if you can.
lectures are terrible and disorganized, teach yourself with loncapa and youtube, don't take this guy if you have a choice because you will realize that our ratings were correct.

If you take classes with this prof, get ready to teach yourself the entire course. His lectures are a disorganized waste of time, and he loves searching up topics that he doesn't know how to explain on google images during lecture time. He tries to be funny, but he's not. His voice is also really annoying.

Paul Li is one of the worst professors at SFU. He barely teaches in class, has truly awful slides, and gives the hardest tests I've ever seen at SFU. The midterm average was 48% with the final average being 37% (in a class of 22). The tutorial is an extension of class with him where he will not answer questions. Please avoid him AT ALL COSTS.

Course content is explained well, backed up by examples and in class problem though his voice can be soft at times. He is very open to questions and answers emails in a short amount of time. Exams are quite fair as he tells you exactly what's on it. Textbook is minimally used. As long as you do Lon capa and read though the examples you'll be fine.
Very Nice Prof, patient and will try his best to explain concepts and answer questions. Shows interest in what he teaches.

Wonderful prof, super helpful, reliable, and makes lectures enjoyable and understandable. Exams are a breeze if you put in the work. Students need to understand that a prof cant feed you the answers you need to put in the work outside of the classroom to do well in any class.
just avoid him
no comment
Below average experience. He is a nice human but doesn't have the best teaching ability.

Paul Li is literally the worst prof I have ever come across. Avoid if you can. If you can't, well then be prepared to teach yourself the whole course, and be destroyed on every exam. My advice? Ride the curve.
worst prof at sfu. Avoid at all costs. Disorganized lectures and horrible exams

Seems like a pretty nice guy but probably the worst prof I've had so far at SFU. Spent most of the time showing us how to do the loncapa q's in class instead of teaching.  Midterms were a joke but the final consisted of most of the long loncapa q's as MC questions. Do not really feel all that prepared for my future analytical courses

Analytical is my favourite chemistry, and Paul Li is the worst prof I have ever had. He doesn't teach, wastes class time because he doesn't know how to do problems and spends vast amounts of time discussing unrelated topics. Unfair midterms and final, impossibly long for the given time period. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
Compare to all analytical professors. He actually TEACHES the best. He REALLY helps you in office hour. However, exams are long but straight forward. I hope he could teach me chem316 but...
